text: today's recipe is maybe one of my
favorite recipes we've created in the
past couple years it's a s'mores pie
across to the graham cracker crust it's
filled with a rich chocolate toasted
marshmallow filling and then topped with
more toasted marshmallows you want to
make it already haven't you tasted it
grind up some graham cracker this is 12
crackers that I'm grinding up it's going
to be about 1 and a half cups of crumbs
and two that you're adding quarter cup
of sugar and five tablespoons of melted
butter then you want to ride it until
everything is moistened give you a
little pulse but it's nice and evenly
coated with the butter and then pour it
into a 9-inch pie plate get it in the
bottom and up the sides as you may or
may not know I like to use the bottom of
a dry measuring cup to do that it packs
it in really well the cup sort of press
it down compact it sort of start that
crust making process and make sure that
it's really nice and even 10 to 12
minutes at 350 degrees the filling is a
ganache filling this is 8 ounces of
semi-sweet or bittersweet chocolate this
is bittersweet which is 71 percent
chocolate and in this pot I have 1 cup
of heavy cream want to bring the cream
just to a boil what you want to do is
just pour it directly over your chopped
chocolate step back and then you just
let it sit there sitting on the
chocolate warming the chocolate for a
few minutes before you start to stir it
so you want to make sure that hot cream
is sitting on the chocolate starts to
melt it if you start too soon the
chocolate will not melt you can add
about 1/8 of a teaspoon or a pinch of
salt to that and just let it sit for a
sec while I'm waiting for this to sort
of melt a little bit three cups of mini
marshmallows that are gonna get toasted
want to do it on a buttered baking sheet
ensure that they don't stick so brush
some butter on a baking sheet and have
your broiler preheating you're doing the
marshmallow toasting step up some mores
in your broiler which works really well
but you do need to keep an eye on your
marshmallows so do not do not walk away
while you're doing this they can catch
on fire if you're not careful I'll
spread these out a little bit and then
injure broiler keep an eye on them when
I'm broiling I like to keep the door
open just a crack not only so that I can
see in there but also because if you
keep the door open the broiler stays on
if you close the door it cycles on and
off and then it takes longer for stuff
to broil and I don't have that kind of
patience you guys know that oh fast the
nice and brown but not completely
collapse so you got to keep a watch on
these so it could take anywhere from
like 15 seconds to a minute depending on
the heat of your broiler now you can
stir your ganache chocolate should have
sat long enough it can take up to 10
minutes but this seems just about right
it was about 5 now what you do is you
spoon this into the ganache you spoon
these marshmallows or scrape them in
dollop I like to leave some streaks of
marshmallow in my ganache so I try to
fold it not too much
fold the marshmallow into the chocolate
now all you do is pour it into your pre
baked shell mm-hmm right now except I
can't eat it right now so I guess I'm
not that happy can't get too happy you
have to let it sit you have to chill it
now all you have to do is wait about two
hours and up to two days in the fridge
now for the final touch for my
beautifully set and delicious pie I'm
going to brulee or brown a few more of
these marshmallows it's totally optional
but I think it's well worth it and it
only takes a few seconds so just brush
another tray
and then in the center of your butter
just pile some more little marshmallows
I like to do it in the middle circle if
I can just so cuz I think it's cute and
then pop that guy into the broiler
keeping an eye on it same thing thirty
seconds one minute
depends on your broiler tada
so there they are I'm gonna maybe butter
my spatula just a little bit cuz I'm
gonna lift it up with a spatula might
make it a little easier to slide off and
then just lift it up from underneath
lift it in little bits and then reform
it on top but I just sort of do this
marshmallow pie I don't think anything
it could be better it's toasted s'mores
pie from me to you you are gonna love it
give it a try
